intro: Maytenus theoides, commonly known as the Brazilian chestnut or theoides tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Maytenus theoides is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems in which it is found.
